column4: the iso got mounted nicely.. but update didnt start automatically, so ran the script with sh
the iso got mounted nicely.. but update didnt start automatically, so ran the script with sh
please help!
somepne! anyone! whats wrong with upgrading from mounted iso!
someone*
okay. the Jaunty alternate iso guys..
could mount it, but no update manager started.. so followed the instruction to run the sh script
first it started and stopped after fetching 875 packages..
then now when m trying to run sh again, its not doing anything
dvd rather..
did the script give an error message when it stopped? also, where did you mount the loopback filesystem?
script didnt give me any error, which means it ran it. and mounted it at /media/isomount folder
any idea why it stopped at 875 packages when it ran the first time?
no. that's why i asked about error messages. can you simply copy the package archive to /var/cache/apt/archives and run update-manager normally?
Hey! that is a nice idea! u mean, i copy the whole archives folder to the apt's cache folder and then run update manager?
worth a try, anyway
okay, i'll try it. Just one last favour. after copying it, what should i run? the update manager from the system->administration menu?
yep. or just "update-manager -c -d" from a terminal.
okay! that sounds cool. hmm.. i wonder why i didnt think of this copying option before! thanks a lot!
yep, have fun
well one more favour.. :p perhaps the last one.. i got the md5 with md5sum command. but with what i should compare it to?
haha.. that is true.. But that is incompetency! a naive user cannot reinstall every other time!
